sn55.20:1.1: Then the Buddha, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, vanished from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared among the gods of the Thirty-Three.
sn55.20:1.2: Then several deities of the company of the Thirty-Three went up to the Buddha, bowed, and stood to one side. The Buddha said to them:
sn55.20:2.1: “Reverends, it’s good to have experiential confidence in the Buddha. …
sn55.20:2.3: It’s the reason why some sentient beings are stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.20:2.4: It’s good to have experiential confidence in the teaching. …
sn55.20:2.6: and to have the ethical conduct that’s loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.
sn55.20:2.7: It’s the reason why some sentient beings are stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
sn55.20:3.1: “Good sir, it’s good to have experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.20:3.3: It’s the reason why some sentient beings are stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.20:3.4: It’s good to have experiential confidence in the teaching. …
sn55.20:3.6: and to have the ethical conduct that’s loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.
sn55.20:3.7: It’s the reason why some sentient beings are stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
